meanings.definition: A type of rock formed from volcanic ash.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists found a piece of tuff during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: The tuff walls of the ancient city were incredibly durable.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the tuff rock was a magical crystal.
meanings.sent4: The tuff cliffs stood tall like guardians of the valley.
meanings.sent5: The tuff stone had intricate patterns from the volcanic eruption.

meanings.sent1: She thought his new jacket looked really tuff.
meanings.sent2: The sunglasses she wore made her look tuff.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked surprisingly tuff in its tiny bowtie.
meanings.sent4: The car's sleek design gave it a tuff appearance on the road.
meanings.sent5: The tuff sneakers were the talk of the school for weeks.

meanings.sent1: Despite the fall, he remained tuff and got back up.
meanings.sent2: The old tree in the yard was incredibly tuff against the storm.
meanings.sent3: The little robot proved to be surprisingly tuff in the competition.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit was as tuff as the steel she worked with.
meanings.sent5: The tuff fabric of the bag could withstand any rough handling.
